h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Turkey?
assumptions: Raw, 85% lean ground turkey; 1 pound ≈ 454 g; no added fat, seasonings, or fillers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, brand, farming practices, and whether raw or cooked. Check labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A pound of raw 85% lean ground turkey contains about 817 kcal and 76 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: Approximately 817 kcal for 1 pound (454 g) of raw 85% lean ground turkey.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: About 76 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Cooking can reduce calories slightly due to fat drainage, but weight loss means higher density per gram.

faqs.q: How does lean percentage affect calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: 93% lean has fewer calories (~140 kcal/100 g) than 85% lean (~180 kcal/100 g) due to less fat.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ground turkey?
faqs.a: No significant carbs—0 g per 100 g in plain ground turkey.
